DoD News: Contracts for December 26, 2006 Bush Meets With Rice & Gates on Iraq VOA 23 Dec 2006 -- Pres. Bush met with top advisers to plan a new way forward in the war in Iraq DoD News: Contracts for December 22, 2006 DoD News: Contracts for December 21, 2006 SecDef Gate Meets Top Iraqi Leaders VOA 21 Dec 2006 -- US SecDef Gates, visited with troops in Baghdad and held meetings with top Iraqi officials DoD News: Contracts for December 20, 2006 Transcript: DoD News Briefing with Secretary Gates from Iraq 20 Dec 2006 AMC KC-135 accident investigation results AFPN 20 Dec 2006 -- Air Mobility Command released the results of its investigation into the Sept. 26 KC-135 and TU-154 Kyrgyz accident CENTCOMs Abizaid Plans Spring Retirement AFPS 20 Dec 2006 -- Gen. John Abizaid, CWENTCOM commander, plans to retire from the Army in the spring DoD News: Contracts for December 19, 2006 Bush to Expand US Military VOA 19 Dec 2006 -- Pres. Bush says he wants to increase the size of the US military in order to wage a sustained war on terrorism Military Health System Governance 19 Dec 2006 -- DoD announced a new military health system governance & management approach First USAF Small Diameter Bomb Full-Rate Production Order Boeing 19 Dec 2006 -- Boeing was awarded a US Air Force full-rate production contract for the Small Diameter Bomb I (SDB I) system. F-35 Development Milestones Northrop Grumman 19 Dec 2006 -- Northrop Grumman reached two major milestones on the F-35 program HAWK TRMF Support Contract Raytheon 19 Dec 2006 -- Raytheon will support US Army HAWK Theater Readiness Monitoring Facilities (TRMF). Excalibur Block Ia-1 Production Configuration Raytheon 19 Dec 2006 -- Raytheon Missile Systems & BAE Systems-Bofors successfully fired 25 GPS-guided Excalibur projectiles during a First Article Test series DoD News: Contracts for December 18, 2006 Gates Sworn In as Defense Secretary AFPS 18 Dec 2006 -- Robert M. Gates was sworn in as the nations 22nd secretary of defense Robert Gates Takes Oath as US Defense Secretary VOA 18 Dec 2006 -- The new U.S. Defense Secretary, Robert Gates, took office Monday Bush & SecDef Ceremonial Swearing-In The White House 18 Dec 2006 New Counterinsurgency Manual AFPS 18 Dec 2006 -- Learn and adapt are the new Army & USMC Counterinsurgency FM's key messages Juneau Concludes Fall Patrol Navy NewsStand 18 Dec 2006 -- USS Juneau (LPD 10) wrapped up its fall patrol Nov. 25, returning to Sasebo Pres.ident  Bush Letter to the Speaker of the House of Rep. & the President Pro Tempore of the Senate The White House 18 Dec 2006 Submarine Multi-Purpose Processors & Monitoring Systems General Dynamics 18 Dec 2006 -- General Dynamics will continue producing A-RCI multi-purpose processor systems and total ship monitoring system kits Detainee Transfer 16 Dec 2006 -- DoD it transferred 7 detainees to Afghanistan, 5 to Yemen, 3 to Kazakhstan, 1 to Libya, & 1 to Bangladesh. Navy & New Uniforms Navy NewsStand 17 Dec 2006 -- The fleet can expect to see two new uniforms in Navy Exchanges by late Summer 2008. USAF KC-X draft request for proposals AFPN 16 Dec 2006 -- Air Force officials released an updated draft Request for Proposals for the KC-X F-35 initial flight success AFPN 16 Dec 2006 -- The Dec. 15 initial flight of the F-35 Lightning II JSF came after 6+ years of development & testing B-52 flight uses synthetic fuel in all eight engines AFPN 15 Dec 2006 -- A B-52 took off Dec. 15 using a blend of synthetic fuel & JP-8 in all engines India eyes first US military planes IRNA 16 Dec 2006 -- India has sought info. on buying what would be its first US military aircraft, six C-130Js Bush & SecDef Rumsfeld Honor Review The White House 15 Dec 2006 Cheney, Pace & Rumsfeld Farewell Ceremony AFPS 15 Dec 2006 Bush Praises Rumsfelds Transformation Efforts AFPS 15 Dec 2006

US Defends Ethiopian Action in Somalia VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- The US said Ethiopia has genuine security concerns in Somalia Islamic Fighters Retreat In Somalia VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Witnesses in Somalia say Islamist fighters have retreated from front-line positions Ethiopian Troops Advance Towards Somali Capital VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Ethiopian troops were heading towards the Somali capital as Islamist fighters retreated from the front line Palestinian Rocket Attacks VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip have fired at least four rockets at Israel Chadian Peace Accord & Rebel Factions VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Two Chadian rebel groups signed an agreement to continue fighting government troops Sudan & AU-UN Peacekeeping Force in Darfur VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Sudan's president told the UN he endorses a plan for a joint U.N.-African Union peacekeeping force in Darfur. UN advisers & Darfur UN News Centre 26 Dec 2006 -- The first group of UN police advisers and military officers will be deployed in Darfur over the next few days Olmert Says He Wants to Renew Peace Talks with Syria VOA 25 Dec 2006 -- Israel says it would like to revive negotiations with neighboring Syria. Ethiopian Jets Bomb Airports in Somalia VOA 25 Dec 2006 -- Ethiopian fighter jets bombed parts of the main airport in Mogadishu and a second airport US Urges Halt to Somali Conflict VOA 25 Dec 2006 -- The Bush administration is urging a halt to conflict in Somalia that has intensified Israeli Cabinet & Palestinian Funds VOA 24 Dec 2006 -- The Israeli govt has decided to transfer $100 million in tax revenues to the Palestinian Authority. Ethiopian Airstrikes & Somalia VOA 24 Dec 2006 -- Ethiopian forces have launched airstrikes against Islamist fighters in neighboring Somalia. Burmese Rebel Leader Bo Mya Dies VOA 24 Dec 2006 -- A longtime leader of Burma's largest ethnic rebel group has died. Somalia's UIC & Foreign Muslim Fighters VOA 23 Dec 2006 -- Somalia's Islamists called on foreign Muslim fighters to help against Somalian govt troops.

CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 26 AFPN 26 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 26. Pakistan-Afghanitsan Border Plans VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Pakistan announced plans to fence and mine sections of its frontier with Afghanistan CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 25 AFPN 25 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 25. US Forces in Baghdad Seize Iranians Invited to Iraq VOA 25 Dec 2006 -- U.S. forces in Baghdad detained several Iranians suspected of inciting attacks against Iraqi troops. UK Forces Destroy Rogue Iraqi Police Station VOA 25 Dec 2006 -- British troops killed seven gunmen & demolished an Iraqi police station in Basra CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 24 AFPN 24 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 24. CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 23 AFPN 23 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 23. Senior Taleban Leader Killed VOA 23 Dec 2006 -- US-led coalition forces killed Mullah Akhtar Mohammad Osmani, a Taleban leader in southern Afghanistan CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 22 AFPN 22 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 22. Afghanistan & Frmr NATO Commander RFE/RL 22 Dec 2006 -- Gen. Jones said pacifying Afghanistan can best be done by shifting the focus to a political solution. CENTAF airpower summary for Dec. 21 AFPN 21 Dec 2006 -- USCENTAF officials have released the airpower summary for Dec. 21. Bagram opens $68 million runway AFPN 21 Dec 2006 -- A new $68 million runway was opened and celebrated Dec. 20 at Bagram Air Base, Afghanistan.
Begin End Begin End Begin End Begin End Begin End Begin End

Saddam Death Sentence Upheld VOA 26 Dec 2006 -- Iraq's highest appeals court has upheld the death sentence for Saddam Hussein US Legislators, Troops & Iraq Violence VOA 24 Dec 2006 -- Continued violence and sectarian strife have led President Bush to reassess U.S. strategy in Iraq. Turkmen President Niyazov Laid To Rest RFE/RL 24 Dec 2006 -- Thousands of mourners laid flowers and said their last farewellsTurkmenbashi Iraqis & Sectarian Violence VOA 23 Dec 2006 -- The security situation in Baghdad continues to deteriorate as sectarian violence grows Leader of Turkmenistan Dies VOA 21 Dec 2006 -- The authoritarian leader of Turkmenistan, Saparmurat Niyazov, has died suddenly of cardiac arrest Bush: Victory in Iraq Achievable AFPS 20 Dec 2006 -- Victory in Iraq is achievable, and retreat from Iraq is not an option, Pres. Bush said Iraq Officials Assume Control in An Najaf AFPS 20 Dec 2006 -- Iraqi officials in An Najaf assumed security control of the province Gates Arrives in Baghdad AFPS 20 Dec 2006 -- SecDef Gates arrived in Baghdad on a surprise pre-Christmas visit to meet with troops, generals and Iraqi leaders Rep. Skelton & Strategy On Iraq RFE/RL 20 Dec 2006 -- The November 7 legislative elections gave the U.S. Democratic Party majorities in both houses of Congress. Iraq Vice President Appeals For More Coalition Troops RFE/RL 20 Dec 2006 -- Iraqi VP al-Hashimi said he remains optimistic about Iraq's future, despite the spiraling wave of violence Syria ready to discuss Iraq RIA Novosti 19 Dec 2006 -- Syria is ready to maintain dialogue on the situation in Iraq with all concerned parties Prosecutors, Saddam & Chemical Attacks VOA 19 Dec 2006 -- Prosecutors showed docs linking Saddam to CW attacks against Kurds US Army & Iraq Training VOA 18 Dec 2006 -- In the Iraq debate, there is broad agreement on the need for more U.S. troops dedicated to training the Iraqi army and police forces Kidnappings & Iraqi Red Crescent VOA 18 Dec 2006 -- The Iraqi Red Crescent suspended its Baghdad ops, after the kidnapping of 30 men Reid & Temporary Force Increase In Iraq RFE/RL 18 Dec 2006 -- Sen. Reid says he would support increasing the number of U.S. troops in Iraq InstanceEndEditable InstanceBeginEditable name="adbot" Begin End InstanceEndEditable Advertise with Us | About Us | GlobalSecurity.org In the News | Internships | Site Map | Privacy Copyright © 2000-2006 GlobalSecurity.org All rights reserved.
